column1: sharkû is an Orkish word meaning "old man".
column2: p. 763Robert Foster used the form sharkú in his The Complete Guide to Middle-earth (see entry for Sharkey). Modified to fit the Westron (and anglicized in The Lord of the Rings) it was rendered as "Sharkey"
column3: used by the Orcs and Men of Isengard as a nickname for their leader

column1: Andreas Möhn has suggested that sharkû might be derived from a hypothetical Mannish Sundocarme ZAR. The ending could be identified with the ending seen in Gandalf#Names.
